title: For Sale:  8 mm x 56 R.
postcontent: This is not the common modern 8 mm ammo - this ammo is for the Mannlicher M95 rifle, designated the M-30 or M-31 cartridge and marked with a large "S" for "Spitexgeschoss" (spitzer). The ammo comes in 10-round boxes, with two 5-round pre-loaded steel clips in each box. The ammo was manufactured in Austria in 1938 - yeah, it's really old, but it's also true history - this was made for Hitler's 3rd Reich and has nazi proof marks. The wedge-shaped boxes are so intricate with sleeves and flaps that they're like a puzzle box, and have labels containing the nazi eagle over a swastika, along with other identifying info. The headstamps have "1938", "VIII" (the year of manufacture in Roman numerals), and the nazi eagle over a swastika. Each clip is stamped with either a nazi eagle with swastika, or an Austrian two-headed eagle, with the majority being the nazi stamp. The clips have finger grooves at the top to help remind the troops which way to properly insert the clips in the rifle, so that they don't get loaded upside-down
